Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
That being said, as a viewer I was still taken by this classic Disney film when I rewatched it lately: I think one can’t be aware of ‘hundreds’ of movies without looking back at your previous foundictions.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is typical of the type of program churned out by Italian action movie production companies, but it’s better than most due to its decent stunt sequences and reasonable story line.
